trial_identification.studytitle: Pharmacokinetic Study of the Modern Chinese Medicine Dantonic in a healthy Western Population
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Pharmacokinetic Study of the Modern Chinese Medicine Dantonic (Registered Trademark) (T89) in a healthy Western Population

interventions.interventions:
a) name: Dantonic (coded as T89) b) dose administered: 1 gram (4 capsules) per time c) mode administered: oral capsule
This is a multiple-dose study in four groups (6 cases each): Group A: oral taking T89, 4 capsules per time, twice per day for one day: Group B: oral taking T89, 4 capsules per time, twice per day for 2 days; Group C: oral taking T89, 4 capsules per time, twice per day for 3 days; and Group D: oral taking T89, 4 capsules per time, twice per day for 4 days.

primaryOutcome.outcome: For pharmacokinetics, assessment of the levels of the major chemical compounds in this herbal medicine in the blood and urine samples of the testing people, by using a HPLC technique at the Monash research lab
primaryOutcome.timepoint: at 0, 5min, 10min, 15min, 25min, 35min, 45min, 1.25hrs, 2hrs, 3hrs, 4hrs, 6hrs, and 8hrs in the 1st, 2nd, 3rd, and 4th day following T89 therapy

secondaryOutcome.outcome: for the safety and side effects (e.g. possible changes in ECG, full blood count, and liver and kidney function), at the Monash department to record ECG and at the Alfred hospital pathological lab to determine blood cells, Bilirubin, ALT, AST, Urea, and Creatinine
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: at before and at 24 hours, 48 hours, 3 days, and 4 days after completion of T89 therapy

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This study aims to examine the pharmacokinetics of herbal medicine T89 in healthy western adults. Based on the similar study in Chinese people, it is hypothesised that following an oral administration, T89 will be detectable in the circulation at ~15 minutes, peaked at 60 minutes to 2 hours, significantly reduced at 6 to 8 hours, and undetectable after 12 hours. It is removed from the body through the urine, which starts at ~2 hours and completes within 24 hours following the administration.
